BitmapCachingMethods
 
Packagecom.elad.optimize.cache
Classpublic class BitmapCaching
InheritanceBitmapCaching Object

BitmapCaching API can be useful when you need to cache bitmap. Not only does it takes into account the new features in Flash Player 10.1 it adds utilities that can help for a quick manual caching. The API includes the following static operations:

  • Manually cache as BitmapData
  • Manually cache as Bitmap
  • Cache all children as Bitmap
  • Cache UIComponent
  • Cache as BitmapMatrix

It also includes small utility methods to help you get your content cached and protect innocent bystanders. Additionally, the API is cross platform and will work with Pure AS3, Flex, AIR as well as different versions of the player including FP 9 or FP 10.1, so it will allow you to use what you need based on the platform and FP version you are using.

Method Detail
cacheAsBitmapMatrix()method
public static function cacheAsBitmapMatrix(displayObject:*, scaleX:Number = 1, scaleY:Number = 1, isCacheAsBitmapMatrix:Boolean = true, isCacheAsBitmap:Boolean = false, isDebugMode:Boolean = false):void

The cacheAsBitmapMatrix will allow you to pass a display object and cache a matrix as BitmapMatrix. You can also set the scale property, which will allow you to scale up or down the display object in case you dont need a matrix representation at the same size. Keep in mind that just like cacheAsBitmap, cacheAsBitmapMatrix limits the content to be not more then 1020x1020 pixels and/or about four million pixels.

Parameters

displayObject:*
 
scaleX:Number (default = 1) — sets the scale of the x. Example: 0.5 is 50%
 
scaleY:Number (default = 1) — sets the scale of the y. Example: 0.5 is 50%
 
isCacheAsBitmapMatrix:Boolean (default = true)
 
isCacheAsBitmap:Boolean (default = false)
 
isDebugMode:Boolean (default = false)

cacheUIComponent()method 
public static function cacheUIComponent(component:Object, isCacheAsBitmap:Boolean = true, uicomponentCachePolicy:String = auto, cacheHeuristic:Boolean = true, isDebugMode:Boolean = false):void

Allows you to set cacheUIComponent policy.

Parameters

component:Object
 
isCacheAsBitmap:Boolean (default = true)
 
uicomponentCachePolicy:String (default = auto) — based on UIComponentCachePolicy
 
cacheHeuristic:Boolean (default = true)
 
isDebugMode:Boolean (default = false)

createBitmapClip()method 
public static function createBitmapClip(bitmapData:BitmapData, setClipEventHandlers:Function = null):Bitmap

create a Bitmap based on Sprite provided. You pass the graphic source (which is the sprite with the vector graphic or bitmap representation) and you pass a method that will set the event handlers (in case they are needed). In case you use Flash Professional and the MovieClip is created you wont need this methods.

Parameters

bitmapData:BitmapData
 
setClipEventHandlers:Function (default = null)

Returns
Bitmap — Bitmap based on Sprite provided

public static function createMovieClipBasedOnSprite(spriteSource:Sprite, isCacheAsBitmap:Boolean = false, setClipEventHandlers:Function = null):MovieClip

create a MovieClip based on Sprite provided. You pass the graphic source (which is the sprite with the vector graphic or bitmap representation) and you pass a method that will set the event handlers (in case they are needed). In case you use Flash Professional and the MovieClip is created you wont need this methods.

Parameters

isCacheAsBitmap:Boolean (default = false)
 
setClipEventHandlers:Function (default = null) — event handlers (in case they are needed)

Returns

manualCacheAsBitmap()method 
public static function manualCacheAsBitmap(source:Sprite, main:Object = null):Bitmap

This method can be used to wrap the display object as Bitmap when needed.

Parameters

source:Sprite — holds the sprite source that will be used to cache
 
main:Object (default = null) — it holds the main container, which is different between Flex (FlexGlobals.topLevelApplication), AIR and PureAS project (this).

Returns
Bitmap — Bitmap representation

See also

flash.display.Bitmap
manualCacheAsBitmapData()method 
public static function manualCacheAsBitmapData(source:Sprite, main:Object = null, finalStageQuality:String = low):BitmapData

Using the cacheAsBitmap method instruct the Player to cached the content as a bitmap and to render it on screen. In case a change to the visual ocour then each frame will result in updating the cached copy on memory before updating the screen. The solution is to use a technique where you rasterized and create different bitmap references using the same BitmapData. Then, when you change the visual of the original BitmapData in memory the Flash Player will avoid redrawing, which will reduce CPU usage while keeping a smooth animation.

Parameters

source:Sprite — holds the sprite source that will be used to cache
 
main:Object (default = null) — it holds the main container, which is different between Flex (FlexGlobals.topLevelApplication), AIR and PureAS project (this).
 
finalStageQuality:String (default = low) — based on StageQuality and allow you to set the final stage quality. AIR needs to be set to HIGH since below HIGH will be disregard

Returns
BitmapData — BitmapData representation

See also

flash.display.BitmapData
setAllChildrenCachingPolicy()method 
public static function setAllChildrenCachingPolicy(displayObject:*, isCacheAsBitmap:Boolean = true, isCacheAsBitmapMatrix:Boolean = false, isDebugMode:Boolean = false, scaleXBitmapMatrix:Number = 1, scaleYBitmapMatrix:Number = 1):void

This method allows you to protect innocent bystanders and remove caching once you dont need it any more or set an entire display object and it/'s children. The method iterate throw the class and set every display object caching policy.

Parameters

displayObject:*
 
isCacheAsBitmap:Boolean (default = true)
 
isCacheAsBitmapMatrix:Boolean (default = false)
 
isDebugMode:Boolean (default = false)
 
scaleXBitmapMatrix:Number (default = 1)
 
scaleYBitmapMatrix:Number (default = 1)
